alert.note: Alert for Northwestern San Juan Mountains (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 12 at 3:56AM MST until December 12 at 11:00PM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST THIS EVENING ABOVE 8000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected above 8000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches with locally higher amounts. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Northwest San Juan Mountains. * WHEN...Until 11 PM MST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. The cold wind chills as low as 25 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. A detailed map of the snowfall can be found at: www.weather.gov/gjt/winter.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
